sapia:sect2.title: Download from Maven Repository
sapia:sect2.p: The latest release jar can be downloaded from the Maven repository:

We have been using the Java.net repository, and following some issues with it we decided to set up our own repository under Sapia's web site. In any case, make sure that you configure both repositories in your Maven settings.xml as follows:
sapia:sect2.sapia:code:
...
<repositories> <repository> <id>java.net-m2-repository</id> <name>Java.net Repository for Maven</name> <url>http://download.java.net/maven/2</url> </repository> <repository> <id>sapia-m2-repository</id> <name>Sapia Repository for Maven</name> <url>http://www.sapia-oss.org/maven2</url> </repository>
...
</repositories>
<pluginRepositories> <pluginRepository> <id>java.net-m2-repository</id> <name>Java.net Repository for Maven</name> <url>http://download.java.net/maven/2</url> </pluginRepository> <pluginRepository> <id>sapia-m2-repository</id> <name>Sapia Repository for Maven</name> <url>http://www.sapia-oss.org/maven2</url> </pluginRepository>
...
</pluginRepositories>
...
